Great little soul food place.   I sorta have the feeling they're resting on their reputation a little bit, but overall good food!   I wanna come back and try the ribs.  

If I was craving fried chicken, I'd swing wide and drive across the valley to come to this place. You can't really go wrong.   

Hell Yes Ezekiels!
We almost always go here for fried chicken. It's reasonably priced and leagues better than KFC. My only complaint is that the fried chicken can be oily most times. But still, really good.

My friend found this place and I've been looking for some good soul food! We ordered pickup and ran errands before heading home and the food was still nice and hot! I recommend the fish, mac and cheese and sweet potatoes and every thing else!

Thank goodness I found this place.  I was worried I was going to have to suffer out the rest of my existence in Phoenix without decent fried chicken.  Family owned, friendly, accommodating, and fantastic food are all things I love about many different restaurants, but when they come together in one place, you can bet I'll be a regular.  I happened to be in the Ahwatukee/S Phoenix area for work at the end of the day and found myself checking Yelp for places nearby to pick up dinner.  Ezekiel's popped up, the few reviews were extremely positive, and who am I to turn down chicken if everyone likes it?  

I've been here about 3 times now (with many more visits in the near future), and the food has been consistent, flavorful, hearty, and filling.  The chicken is juicy on the inside with a wonderful lightly crispy skin; I found myself licking the bones for more flavor when I finished off the meat.  The cornbread was the best side, with just the right amount of crumbly graininess, and I would highly recommend ordering extra.  I wasn't too impressed with the green beans (slightly soggy and overcooked), but I refuse to let that detract from the main dish: chicken.  You go to a fried chicken place for the fried chicken, not for vegetables. 

I didn't find the wait too long, though I usually order ahead of time and go pick it up.  I appreciate food cooked to order, rather than food precooked and sitting under a heat lamp.  Yes, more, please!

This place is amazing! I ordered the 2 Piece White Chicken with 2 sides and everything was superb! The chicken was crispy and moist (not dry at all!) the collard greens were great, and the macaroni and cheese was perfect! The pricing is a little off from what they have on the board vs what the have on there flyers/menus but nothing a little updating can't do. I definitely give this restaurant 5 stars and recommend you try this place! Excellent soul food!

I was craving fried chicken so of course I went to Yelp and Ezekiel's popped up. After looking at a few pics of the chicken, mac and cheese and cornbread we hopped in the car and made our way over.

We both ordered the chicken dinner (dark) with mac and cheese and sweet potato casserole. The dinners also come with a piece of cornbread.

The food took a little bit to come out but when it did it was piping hot so you know it's freshly made. The chicken was actually too hot to eat at first so we dove into the sides. The mac and cheese was solid, nice crispy layer on top, not mushy at all. But the sweet potato casserole was fantastic! Big chunks of sweet potato, fluffy marshmallow, mmm, mmm mmm! So good. 

Once the chicken cooled down we quickly made out way through our two pieces each. The coating had good flavor, it wasn't too thick, and the chicken was nice and juicy.    

A man came out from the back at one point and I assume he was the owner as he was going around talking to people. He was very friendly and knew many people by name so this is definitely the kind of place that has regulars. I can see why. Next time my fried chicken craving kicks in again, I would go back for sure.
Crab cakes we're good, greens we're also fresh and good. We don't eat pork or red meat so I'm glad they were vegetarian style . Will be back on my next visit

The Customer Service was Awsome, the Catfish and Tilapia Dinners were good! I just didn't like the potato salad, I also had the Red Velvet Cake, it was heavy and had not taste, the frosting didn't have much if any cream cheese in it, that would have helped the cake taste better. I think I'll try a pie next time. I'm a baker myself so I'm sorta picky when it comes to bake goods! The price is good too for all you get.

Love this place! We usually order by phone and pick up our food up, they are always extremely friendly and helpful; sometimes I call and my kids are loud in the background they are always patient and kind. WE absolutely love their food, My husband loves the yams, as I do; however, my favorite is the collard greens. Chicken and fish is always cooked perfectly, Nom Nom!
The best Southern comfort in AZ... Get Tilapia, candy yams and ma n cheese. It puts a smile on my face every time.

SO impressed with their food! Best cornbread and red velvet cake ever. The catfish I took home was HUGE (and tasty) and was almost too big for my take home box. I'll
eat there every week!

Ryan was craving fried chicken, so we searched for what seemed to be the best place for it. Ezekiel's seemed like our best bet and it was a great choice! 

The woman behind the counter was very sweet and friendly. We ordered the 8 piece fried chicken meal with 3 pieces of corn bread and a side of mac n' cheese. The fried chicken was delicious--not too oily or heavily breaded--and the corn bread....to die for!! Wish there was some jalapeno in it, but they probably don't do that to cater to the bigger population.

It's a little far from us, but whenever we have a future craving for friend chicken, we'll know to come to Ezekiels! I need to try their crab cakes...
Great to see a locally owned, authentic foods restaurant.   Good food, good people. Good pies too!

This was such a great dining experience. The fried chicken is made fresh when you order! Mac and cheese and sweet potatoes were delicious. The owner was so sweet...I felt like I was with family! Can't wait to come back and try some other items off the menu.

Wow! Let me say that again...WOW!!!  This place is so good and it's going to be the cause of me gaining a million pounds since it's so close to my house. This was my first time here, I had no clue that this place was here. The owner told me that they've been here for two years!! I've been missing out for two years! This place is located in the Bashas shopping center, it's sort of behind the Taco Bell. So skip that junk and head straight on over to Ezekiel's!!

I had the Fried Chicken Dinner that comes two pieces of chicken, two sides and cornbread. I got their mac and cheese and french friends. I can hear my arteries clogging, but it's worth it!! The chicken breast was huge and it was super juicy. The breading tasted delicious and crispy. The cornbread. Super super moist, sweet and tasty. I really can't tell you how amazing this chicken is, words don't do it justice. You have to come experience this fried goodness for yourself. The mac and cheese will make your toes curl. No joke. I wish I was joking, but I'm not. I'm as serious as a heat attack. They make that delicious cheesy goodness there and it's baked. "whaaaa?!" you say. yup. It's baked there. The fries were really good too. I don't know what sort of fairy dust they sprinkled on them, but they had me at spud. 

The owners are so friendly and easy going. They made you feel welcome and knew how to treat a customer. 

If you want some real good food, I mean some REALLY good food, your search is over, my friends. I must warn you, your taste buds will never be the same. This is like taking the red pill...there's no going back. Your eyes will be opened to what good soul food is all about.
Excellent soul food that taste delicious. Their customer service was fabulous too. They are a better than Lolos Chicken and Waffles in my opinion

My daughter and I spotted this gem and thought--why not?--so glad I did.  I'm a dessert person...gotta have it after every meal...but this food is so good I don't need dessert (did I just say that?) The chicken, ribs, fish, and all the sides...cornbread--I cannot get enough of this place.  It is now a regular stop for us.

I came here with expectation of the best fried chicken ever. sadly i always have high expectations. I got 2 piece fried chicken dinner with mac n cheese and coleslaw.
The coleslaw was warm, but only because of exposure to the other hot items. they should put cold items in separate containers. the mac and cheese unfortunately was not up to par, the cheese was cooled down to the point it was stuck together and not coating the actual macaroni, so it was boiled macaroni with some cheese in it. 

the chicken was delish tho. very good breading and very crunchy. i would come back and try some of their other items for sure.

First time ever stopping by here after googling best fried chicken. 

Like always, i yelp all the places i go to before i walk in. 
Most of the reviews were good so i was pretty excited. 
I also saw the $10 for $20 deal so i thought, perfect! 

When i walked in, this place looked like a small family place. Which is nice since most of small food joints like his has the best food! 

I showed the guy at the counter the coupon from yelp...he asked me why i bought it? And told me why i gave money to yelp instead of giving it to him...haha. Why offer coupons if you dont want people to use it? 
This made me feel uncomfortable...

I ordered the chicken with the baked macaroni and cole slaw. 
I must say the chicken and the corn bread was really good, but the sides were pretty bland. If i do come back here again, ill probably skip the sides.

Ribs-The meat slid right off the bones. Very tender. Flavor was average.

Mac n Cheese- consistency left me wanting. Chunks of cheese were next to chunks of noodles. Good flavor though.

Cornbread was awesome!

Friendly staff
How are you going to deliver $30 worth of food to a hotel and not provide a knife and fork. Ridiculous! Don't bother ordering delivery!
Very friendly staff. Nothing fancy about this place, it's definitely a home cooked meal type. Food was decent but it took a bit too long to get it.

My husband stopped in to pick up some food for us. This southern girl was craving some down home cooking. It's not been easy to find good much less tolerable. The mac and cheese is just like my momma makes. (Born and raised in Atlanta, GA) The cornbread was moist and delicious. The catfish was good, would like a little less breading. Owners were friendly and it was nice to be more than just a number. Bonus: my husband saw a Cardinal player eating lunch when he went in there. I would definitely go back.
Had the fried chicken was crispy and juicy lots of flavor. They have the best bake beans I ever tasted. Made me feel like I was back down south.
Came late so I ate light. Chicken was moist and staff is extremely friendly. Loved it and next time I'm getting a bigger plate. So much on the menu I want to try

Live in the area but made my first trip to Ezekiel's. It definitely won't be my last! I ordered the Catfish dinner. The 2 catfish filets that were HUGE. It was crispy on the outside and very moist on the inside. I also had the Green beans which were awesome as well as the Mac and cheese. I want crazy about the Mac and cheese but everything else was unbelievable! The portions, even their desserts are much larger than normal.

The staff was the family who own the restaurant. They're very cordial and helpful as well as good cooks! They really appreciate your business. They don't take it for granted as many others do. It's not going to be my last trip here. I can't wait to try their chicken as well as ribs!

The reviews on this place was spot on.  Good food and friendly people.

Used the Yelp app to find a place for dinner near our hotel and this was top of the list.  My son just got his braces so he was all for mash potatoes and baked mac and cheese.

We get greeted when we walk in and asked if we been here before.  We say no and get a quick breakdown of the menu.

We decide on 2 catfish dinner combos, 1 chicken dinner combo and a kids plate.  Cool thing is they have a sign that says food is made to order so it may take up to 20 mins.  I am cool with that especially when they have the warning.

Food comes out piping hot.  If you can be patient let it cool down or dig into the cornbread or sides.  We got green beans, baked mac n cheese, mash potatoes with gravy, and potato salad.  All of them good but the potato salad and the baked mac n cheese were my favorites.  So tasty.  I think I would be good with just those 2 sides.

Once I could hold onto the chicken and fish, I dug right in.  The catfish fillets were huge and covered with breading.  Crispy outside and very moist on the inside.  Very good.  Chicken is lightly breaded and perfectly golden.  Again moist and crispy.  I like the touch of pepper that is part of the coating.  I love my hot sauce so I had to put some Louisiana hot sauce on my chicken.  Mmmmmmmm.

We got there at 630pm and only ones there.  In the hour we were there, the phone was constantly off the hook and the place was half full by the time we left.  

I get how people are giving grief about the decor but c'mon, it's a southern fried food restaurant.  It didn't bother me and the family.  This family owned restaurant is no joke.  

Skip the regular fried chicken place and check these guys out.

I found me some soul, some sweet (potato) salvation in the form of sweet potato pie and fried chicken at Ezekiel's!  The menu has all your soulful favorites such as fried catfish, chicken, ribs, with delicious sides like Mac and cheese, collard greens, and cole slaw. Everything is made fresh from scratch, served with a friendly smile. 

I had the fish and chicken combo ($10.99), which includes your choice of tilapia or catfish,  and any piece of chicken. I chose the catfish with breast and was fully satisfied. The catfish had a crunchy, crispy cornmeal crust with moist, tender, delectable catfish. The fried chicken was superbly seasoned and battered, with very tender meat. The combo includes 2 sides and a piece of cornbread. The collard greens were a warm embrace of tender, smoky, slightly sweet vegetables. The cole slaw was creamy, tangy, and tasted good (But not as good as those collard greens!). 

The only little hiccup was that one person received mac and cheese as a side instead of baked beans. Since he ended up finishing the entire plate, I don't think he seemed to mind though.  :) Also, the food is made on the spot, which means it might take a little bit to get it out to you. But don't worry, it's well worth any wait, because they are infusing your food with a special little bit of heart and soul :) 

The owners are incredibly nice and sweet. Definitely a great place to fill up on Southern eats.

Best chicken in town hands down. Sides are top notch and to this day I have not experienced a bad meal/service. Top notch family owned restaurant in which you always feel welcome. All I can say is enjoy!

This is one of the best souls food spots in Arizona hands down. The food taste just like home. Their sweet potatoes brings back so much memories reminding me of my grandmother. As for their baked macaroni/fried chicken it's something delicious, a must try. This will be my number one got to spot for comfort soul food.
Great food with that back home country flavor. Being from the mid west it is good to have a place that taste like home.
I ordered a catch fish dinner the Catfish was very dry mac & cheese dry very unsatisfied
Best soul food in AZ hands down! You won't be let down! Great food. I always get the mac and cheese, potatoe salad and fried chicken.

This place is exactly what Ahwatukee needed.  Amazing fried chicken with an extremely nice family running it.  The sides are pretty good, but not the star.  I could eat the fried chicken everyday.  The service is always super friendly too.

Finally visited here today. Thought I'd write a review so I just typed in soul food and Eziekels pops up. Let me tell you this place has the best fried chicken I have had in a long long time. Collard greens and Mac n cheese OMG yum. They treat you like family and I can tell you this go there now so you can say I went there before they got popular. Yea it's that good!!!!

Finally found a "Soul Food" restaurant in AZ. Ezekiel's shocked me. My food was made right after ordering (Yes, you heard correctly) No heating lamps or tin pans with burners underneath them. I ordered 2piece chicken Dinner, Collard Greens and Baked Mac & Cheese with Corn Bread. It was ALL good... everything was fresh. No greasy, oily, nothing. Will I, Should I; tell my friends and family ABSOLUTELY!!! Will, I return? of course there's more items on the menu LOL (-;

Grabbed a two piece fried chicken dinner with the baked mac and potato salad to go. The chicken was perfectly crisp and the inside juicy. Straight to the point seasoning, nothing stood out in terms of it but not a terrible point. The baked mac wasn't my cup of tea, the texture didn't make it my favorite side. The potato salad on the other hand was delish! I loved the bits of egg. Bonus points for the scrumptious cornbread. It had the perfect crumble and moisture, yum! 

Friendly customer service is always a win here. I'd love to try their catfish and ribs next time!
Husband and wife team that were very friendly to me when I came in. Food is good! Waited awhile for my order but the owner was apologetic. Cakes awesome!

Tried Ezekiels for the first time tonight and all I have to say is WOW! The fried chicken was outstanding and the green beans and mac n cheese were very good too. Will definitely be back to try more of what they have to offer!!! Yum!

This place was awful!  My husband ordered the crab cakes - they were fishy and tasted like they were from a can,  I had the fried catfish.  It was fair - coating was just cornmeal.  Very dry and tasteless.  The sides were also bland - coleslaw was the best although very sweet.  Cornbread was good.  Woman behind counter was extremely unfriendly.  When she brought our meals, served in to-go boxes, she just threw then on the table.   Meals are pricey.   We had a deal chicken and will never return.

This place was amazing! I visited there today. I recently moved from the East Coast to Arizona and I have not been impressed with the Soul Food. I was so satisfied with the food at Ezekiels. The Corn Bread and Mac and Cheese was great! The Chicken was fried and seasoned perfectly and their customer service was impeccable. It is family owned and the owners are very down to earth. I will definitely revisit this place. I work in a call center with over 1000 employees and will be spreading the word that we have this place located within 10 mins of the job.

I don't use 5 stars unless it is just over the top in every way. That being said, the food here is very very good. We have been here 4 times now with the family and have tried most everything on the menu between us. All the meats are great. large portions and flavorful. All the sides I have tried, of things I like, were very good. The green beans have a different flavor that will make you never want normal green beans again. I never really liked potato salad but they converted me with theirs. Sweet potato side, is a desert in itself. I am a fan of cornbread and this stuff is great. all they need is really good cream butter and the cornbread could be all you would want to eat.
Nice family restaurant, where they truly want to make sure you are happy.

Some deep South south of PHX! Not much to look at but friendly, homespun folk who cover the basics like GrandMa. Flavorful greens, well spiced fried chicken and fish and cheeeeeeezy Mac-n-Cheese!!! Plenty of Hot sauce to o around. And, YES...I ate all of that on one sitting. Go with an appetite for soulful cooking and welcoming, diverse crowd.

Everything was absolutely fabulous!!! The Fried chicken was beyond tasty, it was moist and perfectly seasoned. We tried the greens,  sweet potato's were the best we've ever had, Macaroni & cheese was good, too.  Banana walnut cake, delicious.
Best mom and pop shop! Food is delicious and original. Will pick this place over LoLo's anyday.

The food was great! I ate it so fast had no time to take a picture. They make all of their meat fresh to order. My chicken was hot, fresh, and well seasoned. I wasn't a fan of the ambience, but  the food was great and for  that they get four stars.

Top notch. Everything was spot on, from the greens to the baked mac and cheese, to the perfect catfish and chicken.

Good lord, start with part of your dessert while you're waiting so that you won't get too full to enjoy it. They're ridiculously good

This isn't just "soul food"; this is "food cooked with soul". I'm quite pleased that the other place I tried to visit was closed. Ezekiel's is a true gem!

Yum yum...I love the cabbage. Green beans. Chicken and Catfish. Love this home cooked feel you up and have leftovers for lunch the next day. Fresh cooked awesome food. So glad I found them. Ooo yea the cornbread is the best!!
Good ol southern cuisine. It took a while to prepare so you know it is fresh. Had the fried chicken. It was good, nothing fancy but was cooked through and still juicy.
Best fried chicken in town. A great mom and pop shop with friendly service and amazing soul food. What more could you ask for?
Great chicken! And that sweet potato pie is like grandma's pies! The potato salad a little on the sweet side for my taste. But I'm going back to just get the cornbread today lol

My boyfriend and I give this place. 3.5 stars.. as soon as we can find we were greeted by the owner.. he was very nice and informed us about the menu.. we ordered the 1/4 rib dinner combo and 2 OC chicken combo which came with 2 sides.. we ordered the fries, sweet potatoes, Mac and cheese and collard greens.. the sweet potatoes were our favorite.. the fries came out crispy and the Mac and cheese were good.. the collard greens were just okay.. it was my least favorite side which sucked because I like ordering collard greens at restaurants if they have them.. but otherwise you defin get your money's worth..

Move over Lolo's, Phoenix finally has a good fried chicken restaurant. 
The owner and staff are very friendly.  Everything is homemade, excluding french fries. My order (for three people) consisted of a 12 piece fried chicken with 3 pieces of cornbread and a large serving of collard greens.  The amount of chicken was HUGE and there was plently to take home for left over.  
Bottom line, the fried chicken is fantastic.  
I have no need to go to Lolos anymore; besides the only reason I went there in the first place was for the waffles.
Some of the best soul food this side of the Mississippi. Catfish is best in Ahwatukee

Happy to find another great place in the East Valley for some comfort food. Had the Frie Chicken Combo w/Mac & Cheese & Greens. Entire meal was on point. Looking forward to returning back for the Catfish, and Ribs, just gotta pace myself....

Their fried chicken is awesome! I also had the fried catfish, Mac and cheese and sweet potatoes. It was a good day because of this meal :) the cornbread is delicious too! There is a wait since all meat is cooked to order, so be patient!  It is worth it!

Superb fried chicken. They have a way of making it super juicy on the inside and crunchy on the outside without it being greasy. The baked mac & cheese is good, too. But don't come here in a hurry. It takes 15-20 minutes to get your food after you place your order. Better to call ahead.

The food was mediocre at best. I can cook soul food, who am I kidding, ANY FOOD very well, but I didn't feel like cooking tonight and yelp had a 10 for 20 deal and they had 4 stars. I go in, it's a small restaurant, decor isn't anything...

My niece warned me prior to ordering not to order the fish, it's battered like a fish stick so I stayed away from that. I ordered for me my son and my niece, with my second order I didn't want all dark meat so I order a breast instead of the thigh. When we got our orders, he mixed up which meal I wanted the change made to. That's ok, it happens- he then proceeded with, "that's not what you said you wanted". That to me was rude, I had my niece and son there to verify, then he told me after waiting 25 mins that it would be another 15 mins to fix it. My son is seven, that's not going to work. So I looked at the food, he placed greens in one plate with chicken and cabbage in another plate with the chicken. I'm not sure if he was trying to save money on plates and dishes but then our chicken was soggy by the time we got home...womp womp womp. And the sweet tea, it has to be a powdery drink mix... 

Overall, the food was edible but nothing spectacular and the customer service was subpar. I will not drive that way for soul food again.

Don't be fooled by the lack of plush velvet chairs or mood lighting. This place is about the food! As a true southern Texas gal, I can appreciate the cooking! The chicken was divine! It wasn't dry or overcooked! The coleslaw and green beans were fantastic! The sweet cornbread was like my grandma used to make! Even the sweet tea brought memories of home! We will definitely be back!

I can literally eat their sweet potatoes with marshmallows every single day for the rest of my life. Definitely on the sweeter side but works perfectly for me. Plus they have the chicken that Definitely brings the salt out. They take about 20 min to cook so I always call ahead so it's ready when I get there ! I really love this place. WAY WAY WAY better then lolos dry chicken.
Great food!!!! Thanks for the familial dining in experience and awesome hospitality. I will be back.

I tried out the fried chicken and sides to go.  
Sides:  
Coleslaw was good but it was a bit too sweet for my taste, I preferred it to be more tangy. 
Collard greens:  It was definitely cooked with something smoked, you can taste that---ham hock maybe.  But it was also a tinge sweet.  Never had greens sweet before. Not bad.
Mashed potatoes & Gravy:  Potatoes were real and great--good buttery flavor.  You don't need gravy for it, but together it was really good. 
Cornbread: On point.  Moist, good texture and perfect sweetness.  Oddly enough, the coleslaw was sweeter than the cornbread.  
Mac & Cheese:  It was okay.  I preferred a little something crunchy just for texture.  

Chicken:  
My review of the chicken might have been better if I ate there.  Since I took it to go, the breading may have lost a little crispiness.  It was definitely good.  The skin was crispy, good seasoning and the meat was moist.  

Great flavor for all items and definitely a place to try out.

Above average fried chicken and ribs delivered right to my office. I liked the potato salad and the mac n' cheese but I think everything would have been much better if eaten at the restaurant. 30-min in a foam box doesn't do this type of food any favors.

This place is spectacular.  It's as family owned and operated as you get.  They take pride in their food and they love compliments.  To me, this is comfort food.  The sweet potatoes and collard greens are worth a try.  The cakes are addicting... the chicken... well, don't get me started on the chicken, just look at the stars I rated them.

Had heard about this place thru the grapevine and decided to try it out.  All I can say is Yummmmmm!  Got there right at noon on a Friday.  One other couple was there.  You order at the counter, which we did, then sat and waited.  It was a bit of a wait, but not bad.  By the time our food came out the place was packed.  I had the fried chicken and honestly think it was the best I've ever had.  I also enjoyed the mac and cheese.  My Mom had the shrimp and collard greens which she really enjoyed.  We both said we would order it again.  Our only request is that they up their game on the desserts.  When you are eating Soul food you need to have cobbler!

RUN!! Do NOT walk... to this restaurant! Wow! Home cooking at it's best! I love when people really know how to perfect the basics of home cooking. Everything is hot and fresh. The chicken is moist and crunchy. The Mac and cheese is my Maryland Mac and cheese. Sweet potatoes are SWEET. 
And I'm stuffed. It was worth the 40 minute drive. No frills, just good food.

I have ordered from Ezikels several times and have never been disappointed! Mac and Cheese is the best around, and I take my Mac and Cheese seriously. 

The owners are super sweet and make it a point to spark up interesting conversations. The space is small, yet very clean. 

I recommend this place to anyone who is looking for the best fried chicken in town.

My husband is from Louisiana and we've wanted to try this place.  We had the fried chicken and ribs, both great!  For sides we tried the greens, sweet potatoes, Mac n cheese and macaroni salad.  My husband loved the greens, I loved the sweet potatoes.  

The family that owns it are so nice and helpful, my daughter thought the woman at the front was great.  It took a while to get the food.   You can order ahead or they do local delivery.  Like the other reviews said, it is not fancy, just down home cooking.   

Can't wait to try the desert, people came in just for the banana cake and the triple chocolate cake.

It smelled awesome walking in, so we were really optimistic at the start of our dining experience.  The food was very disappointing.  The catfish was the toughest fish I have ever tried to eat.  The thinner parts of the it were so hard I could not eat at all.  The fried chicken was super dry.  I dont know why they served it to us because it was visibly overcooked.  The marshmallows that I'm assuming were meant for the sweet potatoes were melted on the bun for my catfish sandwich.  The gentleman behind the counter was friendly but nothing was brought to our table.  Which seemed a little strange considering I need to use a cane to walk and I was there with an elderly parent- so to have us keep getting up to come to the counter to get the sodas he forgot to give us, then the chicken which came out later, then sauces.  We took our leftovers with us (which there were a lot of) but we just threw it away somewhere else because we were embarassed that none of us liked it and felt bad throwing it all away in front of them.  Seeing all the good reviews on here I might go try it again.  I really like to support locally owned business.  But it was really bad food even though we wanted to like it.

I am so upset. With all the reviews I thought it would be good, but it's horrible! First off the lady at the counter had no customer service skills but then again no one in Phoenix does! On to the food: I got the catfish dinner, as sides I got mac n cheese, and sweet potatoes. I also added a side of mac n cheese and a crab cake. The crab cake had way to much salt. The mac n cheese had way to much pepper. The greens were sweet and I don't like sweet collard greens but if you add hot sauce it's not that bad. The sweet potatoes are NOTHING like the pictures I see with the marshmallows baked with it. They were canned and they added spices...but they were the best thing on the whole order. I did have corn bread an I will admit that was good. Lastly the catfish.... OMG disgusting!!!! It taste like rubber or like the fish had gone bad but they fried it anywhere. Catfish should flake and be very tender when chewing there's it was like steak. There was NO soul in this soul food. Please don't waste your money. I spent almost $23

Ya know these people are a real nice family from PA. They apparently owned this restaurant there for 30+ years before moving here.

Is it the best soul food? No. However I'd definitely come back at some point. Here are the pros and cons

Pros:

Mac and cheese
Fried Chicken (overall good but needs some seasoning..kinda bland)
The folks (just nice people)
Sweet Potato Pie


The cons:

The place is filthy. Cobwebs etc all over, dirty floors and tables

Lack of spice in chicken

Catfish was real plain and had no real flavor either

Pricey. $25 for an 8 piece with a couple sides


This is a good option if you are in this part of town and need soul food and don't want to drive all the way to Lo Lo's. I have to give Lolo the edge in the flavor dept however. 

If these guys would add a tiny bit of Cayenne and garlic and maybe a little salt to their batter it would be the best in town.

Wow! Everything that I have head about Ezekiel's is true. The Chicken is so good! Crisp crust with moist tender meat. I ordered sides of mac&cheese and greens. Those were really tasty. The cornbread was old fashion good. Everything was really good. The chicken is made to order. It took about a 15 minutes to get my order. It's worth the wait. They also take call in orders and online. The menu has so many items. I'm sure everyone can find something they like. I highly recommend this place.

Ordered through a food delivery service.  Food took  almost an hour and a half.  I called to find out what was taking so long and they said they gave my food to someone else and said they were making another one.  I then get the food and I have no sauce, no silverware, nothing.  Drive to the restaurant and they act like it is my fault for not requesting the silverware and napkins.  What?  Then the fish was soggy on top of it all. They took no accountability for their mess up and acted like it was my fault.  Will not be returning EVER.

Wow. Ezekiel's really blew me away! Being a transplant from the east coast can be rough especially since I'm really not into Mexican cuisine, that's why I was so taken with this place. It was cozy and clean, the food was cooked to order and to perfection and tasted like it was whipped up by the lady from church who you KNOW can throw down at any cookout. Ezekiel's is definitely a hidden gem in Ahwatukee, it's like a secret weapon or something lol plus the staff was awesome too, they knew every person that came in after us personally. Hopefully someday they'll know my name too because I will DEFINITELY be a regular!
Best grub I've had in a long time. Chicken breast was juicy, sweet potatoes on point, corn bread and Mac n cheese was awesome and their banana walnut cake was amazing..amazing

PROS
8PC fried chicken! Crispy and hot! Great deal for all the chicken, half thighs, other half legs and 1 wing, love the dark meat, it's my fave
Sweet potatoes were delish and like candy!
Place was pretty full for a weeknight dinner, seems to have consistent, loyal customers
My friend loved his butterfly shrimp

CONS
The owner was pretty unorganized when taking orders
The AC was barely on and fans were not that helpful

Average mac and cheese...I like the more melty kind and there were just chunks of cheese mixed it

Okay this review is overdue...but I wanted to show Ezekiel's some love. Those who've read my other reviews know that I'm a sucker for soul food and every so often...I must have some YARD BIRD in my life!! I was in Arizona for a friend's retirement...I flew into Phoenix but stayed in Tuscon (yes...I did....it was cheaper...significantly cheaper).  On my departure date...I checked out of the hotel at 12 and my flight leaving PHX was not until later. It's less than a 2hour drive from Tucson to Phoenix....so I would have some time to kill...I immediately thought of finding some fried chicken for lunch! So, I Yelped my way to Ezekiel's. It's a small mom-n-pop joint close to I-10.  I walked in....it was empty. Two gentlemen were sitting and talking (not eating)....I got the impression one (if not both) was affiliated with the restaurant in some professional way. There was a young lady behind the counter....totally immersed in her iPhone. I ordered a 2 piece fried chicken meal (added a 3rd piece...because...well..I'm greedy) with collard greens, potato salad and corn bread. This is where Ezekiel's lost a star from me...I sat at a nearby table and waited.....and waited....and waited. While I waited several folks came in and picked up their call-in orders (I assume). The young lady served them their to-go packages and went back to her iPhone business. The two gentlemen remained immersed in their private conversation. I was getting a little perturbed but honestly...I had plenty of time to kill so I continued to wait. Ultimately though (after 14 minutes), when my food finally came out...it was damn good. I'm a self-proclaimed Yard Bird aficionado so I am qualified to say that Ezekiel's fried chicken is delicious!! The greens were just okay (not seasoned enough for my liking) but the potato salad and cornbread were both good as well. The chicken was piping hot too. So I assumed it was fresh out the grease which could have attributed to the delay. I'm not gonna say it was worth the LONG wait...but it was indeed some yummy chicken. 

PROS:
Delicious fried chicken!!

CONS: 
The wait was brutal. THE PLACE WAS EMPTY!!!!! I felt abandoned. Lol. 

RECOMMENDATION:
Yes! Delicious Fried Chicken. 

SIDE NOTE:
Arizona is hot as hell.....I mean....literally........Arizona is as HOT AS THE DEVIL'S PRIMARY RESIDENCE!! Don't give me that "it's a dry heat" crap either. I live in South Texas.....I know hot weather. The sun is aimed directly at the state of Arizona.....HOT!!!!
I would love to try something else but I keep coming back for the fried Chicken. My daughter is a picky eater and says the corn bread is out of this world

I just finished an amazing lunch here. This was my first time here and it was a little hard to find so I'll let you know it's half-way between Taco Bell and Chuck E. Cheese, along the south edge of the mall it's in.

I had the Fried Chicken Dinner with cornbread, cole slaw and sweet potatoes. The chicken breast was perfectly cooked, crispy outside and so juicy inside. The owners' experience shows in how well everything was prepared and in the way the flavors worked so well together. Even the hot sauce was a perfect compliment to the flavor of the chicken. The portion sizes were generous too. Laurita and Brad were very pleasant to talk with as I waited for my dinner to be cooked to order. Well worth the wait!
Really delish food, fresh, and friendly service. Fried chicken was amazing, really good corn bread.

This place was recommended to my boyfriend and I by an acquaintance of ours. We were looking for something a little different than usual when we stopped by this place. As it turns out, it's a small little restaurant on Warner in the plaza by Basha's, Chuck E. Cheese's, and many other stores. It was a little tricky trying to find the place but we found it okay.

The ambiance has that family owned feel so it wasn't terribly too shocking that it's family run!
 
My boyfriend ordered fried chicken lunch with collard greens, cornbread, and had the Cherry Kool-Aid. I had ordered the tilapia lunch with baked macaroni & cheese, cornbread, and had a soda. The gentleman behind the counter gave us an almost exact time (even though it seemed he was doing everything himself).

Once the food came out, my boyfriend and I dug in! The tilapia tasted extremely fresh! It tasted as though they just caught it this morning! The macaroni & cheese actually tasted like macaroni & cheese! The cornbread was as sweet and wonderful as expected!

I took a bite of my boyfriend's chicken just to try how his chicken was - and it was perfectly crisp, seasoned, and delicious! The collard greens were also really delicious!

Originally, we were planning to purchase & eat some dessert but by the time we were done (and we literally ate everything on our plates), we just couldn't eat any more.

However, this restaurant isn't without its criticisms. The Cherry Kool-Aid was way too sweet! Normally, I could handle a lot of sweetened drinks but with this Kool-Aid, it's just way too sweet! I don't know how my boyfriend could handle it since he doesn't really like sweets that much himself. While both the macaroni & cheese and collard greens were extremely delicious, it was still a bit bland. However, it's nothing a little extra salt and pepper couldn't fix.

Now the question remains: would we return to Ezekiel's Restaurant? Of course we would! Despite the minor complaints we share, we can definitely see ourselves become regulars here!

Just got done eating here and The food was amazing the best friend chicken I've ever had. The service was also outstanding! The people that own this place really makes you feel comfortable and welcome.  I would recommend This restaurant to everybody I know.

My wife seen this place on pbs Arizona eats and Id have to say it's some of the best fried chicken I've ever ate. Not greasy and completely delicious, the skin is like candy, I can't wait to try the fish and the ribs. Service was amazing, very friendly good people thank you for making our community better.

Best fried chicken in Ahwatukee? How about best fried chicken west of the Mississippi River! Lunch was fabulous! Fried chicken, cole slaw, perfect. Next "don't feel like cooking " evening I'll be getting a whole bucket!!

Best fried chicken I have had in Arizona ! I know I said the same thing in the past about lolos chicken, but wow this place blows lolos out of the water and then some! Since they have gone down greatly in quality, I decided to venture into new fried chicken territory and I am so glad I did!

The chicken is nice and crispy on the outside and super juicy on the inside and not greasy at all! The cornbread is yummy and the sweet potatoes are delish! Give them a try, I ordered through UberEATS and can't wait to have them again, when it's been a respectable amount of time between fried chicken feasts!
This place is amazing. The food is just fantastic and the service and kindness of the the owner is unmatched.

OMG get a cake...get the cakes...get the cake. SO GOOD! This food fills you up and makes you feel comforted. Le sigh. 

I am full, and happy. Food make with love : )
Wow real down home soul food in AZ and so super friendly! If you love soul food you will love this place! Not fancy by any means but super good! Try it you won't be sorry.

This little place is a hidden gem. Don't pass it up - terrific food, friendly people, and did I mention terrific food? We had ribs and fried chicken and several side dishes. The ribs were tender and meaty with a delectable bbq sauce. The chicken was lightly battered, peppery, hot and delicious. Sides - collard greens to beat all, fried cabbage, sweet potatoes that were sweeeeet and green beans that were good too. The cornbread was a bit sweet, but dry. It could use a little butter and honey I think. But hey Ezekiel's I will be back again and again and again. Yum.

Sooo good!  I had the 2 piece white fried chicken and my husband had the dark meat. It was cooked perfectly and just delicious. I had the mac and cheese and sweet potatoes and my husband had the green beans and french fries. I think the mac and cheese was almost as good as mine! The prices were very good and the owners were very nice, and very personable. We chatted through our meal as though we were old friends. Very much looking forward to going back

The most satisfying soul food, cooked and served by some of the most gracious, warmest people around these parts.  

This is the nostalgic 'back home' that we all secretly long to go to, even if it's just a dinky little soul food restaurant tucked into a strip mall in Ahwatukee.

Fried chicken, catfish, BBQ, buttered corn, collard greens, macaroni and cheese, coleslaw, corn bread, candied sweet potatoes, Kool-Aid, lemonaid...all this deliciousness awaits you here.

This is my first time trying soul food and I have to admit that it was very good. The store is owned/operated by a married couple who are super funny and friendly. The menus have lots of choices and combos to choose from at reasonable prices. I ordered a 2 pieces of dark meat chicken (leg & breast). It was super tender and juicy. I don't remember the last time I had fried chicken this good. My meal also comes with corn bread and two sides and I choose sweet potatoes and claw. They both both equally delicious. The corn bread was soft , fluffy and buttery. My friends and I enjoyed our meals. We had good laughs with the regulars as well as the owner. I highly recommend this place to anyone who loves soul food.
